stem: Fracture of the fibular neck injures the common peroneal (fibular) nerve. Which finding is most characteristic?

choices.A: Loss of plantarflexion and toe flexion
choices.C: Foot drop from loss of dorsiflexion with impaired eversion

rationale_correct: Common peroneal nerve lesion denervates anterior and lateral leg compartments → dorsiflexion and eversion deficits (foot drop).

rationale_distractors.E: Inversion is split (tibialis anterior/posterior); isolated inversion loss is not typical for CPN.

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout — Leg compartments and innervation. Jun 16, 2025.
